description:
**Weaviate**

Weaviate is a self-hosted vector database that enables accurate and efficient storage and querying of unstructured data. This dashboard showcases important insights and metrics enabling you to monitor the health of your Weaviate instances. 

**Further reading:**

- [Datadog Weaviate Integration Documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/weaviate/)
- [How Datadog monitors Weaviate and other AI stack technologies](https://www.datadoghq.com/blog/ai-integrations)
- [Weaviate Monitoring Docs](https://weaviate.io/developers/weaviate/configuration/monitoring)
title: Weaviate Overview Dashboard

definition.content:
**Weaviate**

Weaviate is a self-hosted vector database that enables accurate and efficient storage and querying of unstructured data. This dashboard showcases important insights and metrics enabling you to monitor the health of your Weaviate instances.

**Further reading:**

- [Datadog Weaviate Integration Documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/weaviate/)
- [How Datadog monitors Weaviate and other AI stack technologies](https://www.datadoghq.com/blog/ai-integrations)
- [Weaviate Monitoring Docs](https://weaviate.io/developers/weaviate/configuration/monitoring)
The overview section gives you a high-level overview of your system, including monitors with active alerts and service checks on the health of you Weaviate instance.

Monitoring the size of the vector index and the duration of insert, delete, and maintenance operations is crucial to understand the efficiency and performance of the vector database. These metrics help identify potential storage issues, bottlenecks, and assess the impact of data modifications on system responsiveness.

Tracking query latency, rate, and concurrent read/write requests enables the evaluation of the vector database's overall responsiveness and load handling capabilities. It aids in optimizing query performance, identifying high-demand periods, and planning for scalability.

queries.name: query1
queries.query: sum:weaviate.concurrent.queries{(query_type:aggregate OR query_type:get_graphql OR query_type:get_object OR query_type:head_object) AND $host AND $class_name AND $shard_name} by {query_type}

queries.name: query1
queries.query: sum:weaviate.concurrent.queries{(query_type:aggregate OR query_type:get_graphql OR query_type:get_object OR query_type:head_object) AND $host AND $class_name AND $shard_name} by {query_type}

queries.name: query1
queries.query: sum:weaviate.concurrent.queries{(query_type:batch OR query_type:batch_references OR query_type:add_object OR query_type:update_object OR query_type:merge_object OR query_type:delete_object OR query_type:add_reference OR query_type:update_reference OR query_type:delete_reference) AND $host AND $class_name AND $shard_name} by {query_type}

queries.name: query1
queries.query: sum:weaviate.concurrent.queries{(query_type:batch OR query_type:batch_references OR query_type:add_object OR query_type:update_object OR query_type:merge_object OR query_type:delete_object OR query_type:add_reference OR query_type:update_reference OR query_type:delete_reference) AND $host AND $class_name AND $shard_name} by {query_type}

definition.content: LSM (Log-Structured Merge) stats provide insights into the underlying storage structure's health and efficiency. Monitoring segment and memtable sizes helps optimize space utilization, while tracking bloom filter access aids in evaluating query performance and data retrieval efficiency.

definition.title: LSM Segment Size by Level and Unit

definition.content: Measuring the average time taken for "put" (write) operations and batch delete duration is essential for understanding the write performance and efficiency of bulk deletion processes. This information is valuable for optimizing write-heavy workloads and data management.

These import-related metrics offer insights into the data loading process, ensuring smooth and efficient data ingestion. Monitoring tombstone cleanup threads and active LSM segments helps maintain database health and performance during data imports.

Keeping track of backup and startup-related metrics is vital for disaster recovery planning and assessing system reliability. Monitoring storage time, disk I/O, and data restoration provides crucial information to manage backups effectively and minimize downtime during startup and recovery scenarios.
